Term.Name: Camera Electronic Motion
Term.Definition: Apparatus, consisting of a light-proof box and a lens, which forms a representation of a real-world visual object. The camera converts the representation (of a sequence of images) into electrical impulses for transmission or onward storage
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Camera Electronic Still
Term.Definition: Apparatus, consisting of a light-proof box and a lens, which forms a representation of a real-world visual object. The camera converts the representation (of a single image, or mulltiple single images intended to be viewed individually) into electrical impulses for transmission or onward storage
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Camera Film Motion
Term.Definition: Apparatus, consisting of a light-proof box and a lens, which forms a representation of a real-world visual object. A camera with a shutter mechanism which stores a sequence of images (designed to be viewed as a sequence) onto chemical-based motion-picture film
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Camera Film Still
Term.Definition: Apparatus, consisting of a light-proof box and a lens, which forms a representation of a real-world visual object. A camera with a shutter mechanism which stores a single image (or multiple single images, designed to be viewed individually) onto chemical based film
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Microphone Condenser
Term.Definition: A microphone is a device for converting sound waves into electrical energy variations
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Microphone Dynamic
Term.Definition: A microphone is a device for converting sound waves into electrical energy variations
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Amplifier
Term.Definition: A machine for amplifying sound
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cassette Deck
Term.Definition: A deck for use with standard audio cassettes. This may have play and record facilities
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: CD Burner
Term.Definition: A machine which can produce standard music compact discs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: CD Player
Term.Definition: A machine which can play standard music compact discs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Cine Projector
Term.Definition: A projector for showing cine film
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DAT Machine
Term.Definition: A machine for playing and recording Digital Audio Tape (DAT)
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DVD Player
Term.Definition: A machine for playing Digital Video Discs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: DVD Burner
Term.Definition: A machine which can produce standard digital video discs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Minidisc Player
Term.Definition: A machine for playing and/or recording music mini discs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Non-linear Editor
Term.Definition: An editing tool which makes use of computer technology to edit a programme or item virtually using references to data stored on hard disk
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Personal Computer
Term.Definition: A personal computer. This includes desktop and laptop machines and may refer to IBM compatible machines or Apple Macs
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Radio Receiver
Term.Definition: Any receiver capable of receiving audio radio broadcasts
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Record Turntable
Term.Definition: A turntable designed for use with vinyl records. For the purposes of this definition the turntable also includes the arm, stylus and cartridge
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Reel to Reel Audio Tape Deck
Term.Definition: A device for playing or recording magnetic audio tape
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Sound Mixer
Term.Definition: A device, usually in the form of a mixer desk, for mixing together inputs either from devices such as microphones or electronic musical instruments, or from pre-recorded sources. Sound mixers can be used to produce live or recorded output
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Telecine Machine
Term.Definition: A device which is used to play cinema film to produce television output
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Television Receiver
Term.Definition: A television set. This may refer to digital or analogue sets
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Video Player
Term.Definition: Any device which can be used to play video tape. Note that there are many different formats of video tape in use in the media industry and most machines will only be able to play tapes of one type. However, some machines are able to use multiple types
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML

Term.Name: Vision Mixer
Term.Definition: A device, usually in the form of a mixer desk, for mixing together various streams of visual input. This can include live studio and outside broadcast feeds as well as video, still and graphic material. Mixers can also be used to apply captions and titles.Vision mixers can be used to produce live or recorded output
Term.ChangeComment: First version after conversion of P/META into XML
